intro: Thelasis wariana, commonly known as the wariana thistle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust, hairy stems. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with dark green, lance-shaped leaves that have serrated edges. Its showy yellow flowers bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Thelasis wariana is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
